ch01

Class Philosopher

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch01.Philosopher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IChopStickConsumer

    public class Philosopher
extends java.lang.Object
implements IChopStickConsumer
    A consumer that can handle one chopstick.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String name
      Philosopher's name.
      int timeSpentHoldingChopStick
      Each time the timer runs this is incremented by 1 if the philosopher is holding a stick.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Philosopher(java.lang.String name)
      When creating a philosopher, it is required to give it a name.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getChopstickID()
      Returns the id of the chopstick held by the philosopher.
      ChopStick returnChopStick()
      Returns the chopstick held by the philosopher.
      void takeChopStick(ChopStick c)
      Method to be called when assigning a chopstick to the philosopher.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • name

        public java.lang.String name
        Philosopher's name.

      • timeSpentHoldingChopStick

        public int timeSpentHoldingChopStick
        Each time the timer runs this is incremented by 1 if the philosopher is holding a stick.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Philosopher

        public Philosopher(java.lang.String name)
        When creating a philosopher, it is required to give it a name. The initial chopsticks are set to null and the timeSpentHoldingChopStick counter to zero.
        Parameters:
        name - any name for the philosopher.

    • Method Detail

      • takeChopStick

        public void takeChopStick(ChopStick c)
        Method to be called when assigning a chopstick to the philosopher. A philosopher can handle only one stick at a time.
        Specified by:
        takeChopStick in interface IChopStickConsumer
        Parameters:
        c - a ChopStick object.

      • returnChopStick

        public ChopStick returnChopStick()
        Returns the chopstick held by the philosopher. The philosopher is not holding anymore the stick after returning it.
        Specified by:
        returnChopStick in interface IChopStickConsumer
        Returns:
        a CandleStick object if held by the philosopher. "null" otherwise.

      • getChopstickID

        public java.lang.String getChopstickID()
        Returns the id of the chopstick held by the philosopher.
        Returns:
        the string with the name or null if the philosopher does not have any stick.
